definitions.definition: A small corner formed by two walls; an alcove.
definitions.example: There was a small broom for sweeping ash kept in the nook between the fireplace bricks and the wall.

definitions.definition: A hidden or secluded spot; a secluded retreat.
definitions.example: The back of the used book shop was one of her favorite nooks; she could read for hours and no one would bother her or pester her to buy.

definitions.definition: A recess, cove or hollow.
An English unit of land area, originally 1/4 of a yardland but later 12 1/2 or 20 acres.
A corner of a piece of land; an angled piece of land, especially one extending into other land.
A nucleus colony; a small bee colony created from a larger colony.
The spinal cord.
The back of the neck, the nape; of an animal: the back of the head or the portion of the body behind the head.
A nuclear weapon.
(by extension) Something that destroys or negates, especially on a catastrophic scale.
A nuclear power station.
A vessel such as a ship or submarine running on nuclear power.
A person (such as a sailor in a navy or a scientist) who works with nuclear weapons or nuclear power.
A microwave oven.
definitions.example: Just put it in the nuke for two minutes and it will be ready to eat.

definitions.definition: To use a nuclear weapon on a target.
definitions.example: If a nuclear war ever breaks out, military facilities are likely to be nuked first.

definitions.definition: To destroy or erase completely.
definitions.example: To try to hide his posting history on Usenet, he had his posts nuked from the Google archives.

definitions.definition: (by extension) To carry out a denial-of-service attack against (an IRC user).
To expose to some form of radiation.
To cook in a microwave oven.
definitions.example: I’ll nuke some pizza for dinner.

definitions.definition: To over-analyze or overly despair over something.
